attributes.action: Provide sufficient Dalysis capacity to enable patients to Dialyse away from their home unit
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Dialysis patients dialyse three days a week for the rest of their life until they die.  These patients cannot undertake work that takes them away from their Dialysis unit, have a holiday, attend family celebrations ( weddings, baptisms etc ) or visit friends or relatives.  They call on the prime Minister to provide sufficient spare capacity in Dialysis units around the country to enable patients to move between units.  This would dramatically improve what is currently a poor and restricted quality of life. After all the Prime Minister puts high value on his holiday - he should not deny patients the same basic human right.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Provide sufficient Dalysis capacity to enable patients to Dialyse away from their home unit."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
